line_2: And much her righteous spirit grieves,

line_1: She mocks her maker and herself deceives,
line_2: That while she doats and dreams that she believes,

line_1: Feeds his false Doubt, and thus himself deceives.
line_2: To strange Effects, when prov'd, no Credit gives,

line_1: The Fowler thus the feather'd Race deceives,
line_2: And strows beneath his Snare the rifled Sheaves.

line_1: But ah! the shade my empty grasp deceives;
line_2: And as it flits, and my fond soul bereaves,

line_1: And thus the intermediate time deceives.
line_2: Each thinks Alcestes as himself believes,
Like aspine shake the restless leaves,

line_1: Pleas'd, when his Reason He deceives;
The deadly Night-shade wanton Youth deceives
line_2: With shining Berries, and with spreading Leaves;

line_1: With quivering beam, that oft deceives,
line_2: While spreading foil on spangl'd leaves;

line_1: No, no; I fear the flatt'ring Tale deceives;
line_2: Methinks I see him plunging in the Waves.
